intro: Sida hackettiana, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny environments such as wetlands and disturbed soils. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Sida hackettiana is often found in wetland habitats and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
